    • Method Detail

      • getNeoDeviceConnected

        public boolean getNeoDeviceConnected()
        Check to see if Android is connected to a Neosensory device
        Returns:
        True if connected. False otherwise.

      • getNeoCliReady

        public boolean getNeoCliReady()
        Check to see if a command line interface (CLI) is ready and available to accept commands
        Returns:
        True if the CLI is ready and available. False otherwise.

      • getNeoCliResponse

        public java.lang.String getNeoCliResponse()
        Get last obtained response from the command line interface (CLI)
        Returns:
        last obtained response as a String.

      • pauseDeviceAlgorithm

        public void pauseDeviceAlgorithm()
        Pause the running algorithm on the device to accept motor control over the CLI. This command requires successful * developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail. TODO: handle returning JSON responses from device

      • resumeDeviceAlgorithm

        public void resumeDeviceAlgorithm()
        (Re)starts the device’s microphone audio acquisition / algorithm. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail. This is functionally the same as startAudio();

      • sendDeveloperAPIAuth

        public boolean sendDeveloperAPIAuth()
        Request developer authorization. The CLI returns the message “Please type 'accept' and hit enter to agree to Neosensory Inc's Developer Terms and Conditions, which can be viewed at https://neosensory.com/legal/dev-terms-service
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • acceptApiTerms

        public boolean acceptApiTerms()
        After successfully calling auth as developer, use the accept command to agree to the Neosensory Developer API License (https://neosensory.com/legal/dev-terms-service/). Successfully calling this unlocks the following commands: audio start, audio stop, motors_clear_queue, motors start, motors_stop, motors vibrate.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • startAudio

        public boolean startAudio()
        (Re)starts the device’s microphone audio acquisition. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • stopAudio

        public boolean stopAudio()
        Stop the device’s microphone audio acquisition. This should be called prior to transmitting motor vibration data. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • getBatteryLevel

        public boolean getBatteryLevel()
        Obtain the device’s battery level in %. This command does not require developer authorization
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • getDeviceInfo

        public boolean getDeviceInfo()
        Obtain various device and firmware information. This command does not require developer authorization.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • clearMotorQueue

        public boolean clearMotorQueue()
        Clear any vibration commands sitting the device’s motor FIFO queue. This should be called prior to streaming control frames using motors vibrate. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • enableMotors

        public boolean enableMotors()
        Initialize and start the motors interface. The motors can then accept motors vibrate commands. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • disableMotors

        public boolean disableMotors()
        Clear the motors command queue and shut down the motor drivers. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • stopMotors

        public boolean stopMotors()
        Send a frame that turns off the motors. Note the API CLI command "motors stop" disables the motor drivers. This command requires successful developer authorization, otherwise, the command will fail.
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • vibrateMotors

        public boolean vibrateMotors(int[] motorValues)
        Set the actuators amplitudes on a connected Neosensory device. Note: actuators will stay vibrating indefinitely on the last frame received until a new control * frame is received
        Parameters:
        motorValues - byte array of length # of motors of the target device (e.g. should be 4 if a Neosensory Buzz). Element values should between 0 (motor off) and 255 (motor at full amplitude). Example input format: new byte[] {(byte) 155, (byte) 0, (byte) 0, (byte) 0};
        Returns:
        true if connected to a valid device that is ready to accept CLI commands. TODO: handle returning JSON response from the device

      • disconnectNeoDevice

        public void disconnectNeoDevice()
        If connected to a Neosensory device, disconnect it

      • attemptNeoReconnect

        public void attemptNeoReconnect()
        Attempt to reconnect to a Neosensory device if disconnected

      • requestBluetoothOn

        public static void requestBluetoothOn(android.app.Activity activity)
        Request the Activity enable Bluetooth
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity trying to call this. Typically you would pass in the variable `this` from the Activity.

      • getInstance

        public static NeosensoryBlessed getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.lang.String[] neoNames,
                                            boolean autoReconnect)
        Create and return instance using constructor used to connect to first discovered device containing the name "Buzz" NOTE: There should only exist one instance of NeosensoryBlessed at a time. If you try to create a new instance, the parameters will be ignored and you'll get the previously created instance.
        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context * @param[in] autoReconnect boolean for if the Bluetooth handler should automatically attempt to * reconnect to the device if a connection is lost.
        neoNames - a list of Strings for finding a potential device to connect to by name. For example, if given just the entry {"Buzz"}, the module will attempt to connect to the first device found containing the "Buzz" in the name.
        autoReconnect - boolean for if the Bluetooth handler should automatically attempt to * reconnect to the device if a connection is lost.
        Returns:
        the instance of the NeosensoryBlessed object

      • getInstance

        public static NeosensoryBlessed getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.lang.String neoAddress,
                                            boolean autoReconnect)
        Create and return instance using constructor used to connect to a device with a specific address e.g. "EB:CA:85:38:19:1D" context the Android Context. NOTE: There should only exist one instance of NeosensoryBlessed at a * time. If you try to create a new instance, the parameters will be ignored and you'll get the * previously created instance.
        Parameters:
        neoAddress - string in the format of a desired address e.g. "EB:CA:85:38:19:1D"
        autoReconnect - boolean for if the Bluetooth handler should automatically attempt to reconnect to the device if a connection is lost.
        Returns:
        the instance of the NeosensoryBlessed object
